column4: hey i'm trying to install java but i cant figure out how to run the .bin file, can someone help please?
java should already be on ubuntu
did you try apt-get command?
what are you trying to load in java? try System > Preferences > Sun Java... look in there
is teamspeak being run under wine?
guess not. what type of file is it?
are you running it in terminal?
so when you type sh filename.sh nothing happens?
i'll download it
it is a tar.gz file for me
yes
ftp://ftp.freenet.de/pub/4players/teamspeak.org/releases/ts2_client_rc2_2032.tar.bz2
wait...
are you root?
try chmodding it to 777
that's perfect output
double click setup.sh and say run in terminal and it should work
you chmodded it to 777 ... ummm try sudo sh setup.sh
ungh... that's what i got when i downloaded it....
read the readme file and install it manually
then it will work
